bioprojects.title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37RvAE Genome sequencing and assembly

owner.name: Texas A&M University, Department of Computer Science and Engineering

attributes.name: subsrc_note
attributes.value: H37RvAE is a Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv strain from William Jacobs's lab, and AE stands for Albert Einstein College of Medicine

assembly_info.comments:
Bacteria available from William Jacobs, Albert Einstein College of Medicine, NY
This sequence was used to estimate variation of H37Rv strains from multiple labs and the possible errors in the original H37Rv sequence which was completed in 1998.
A single contig was split into two, AORP01000001 and AORP01000012. Consequently, the first and last contigs are contiguous. This split was to preserve the genome coordinates relative to other Mycobacterium tuberculosis where the first base starts at the origin of replication.

bioprojects.title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis PanR0313 Genome sequencing and assembly

assembly_info.comments:
Reference-guided assembly based on Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv.
The first and last contigs are contiguous. A single contig was split into two, in order to make dnaA the first gene in the chromosome.
Bacteria and source DNA available from Fedora Lanzas, Instituto Conmemorativo Gorgas de Estudios de la Salud, ICGES, Panama

bioprojects.title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37RvLP Genome sequencing

owner.name: Texas A&M University, Department of Computer Science and Engineering

attributes.name: subsrc_note
attributes.value: H37RvLP is a Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv strain from Tanya Parish's lab, and LP stands for London Pride.

assembly_info.comments:
Bacteria available from: Tanya Parish, Infectious Disease Research Institute, Seattle, WA.
This sequence was used to estimate variation of H37Rv strains from multiple labs and the possible errors in the original H37Rv sequence which was completed in 1998.
A single contig was split into two, JREW01000001 and JREW01000088. Consequently, the first and last contigs are contiguous. This split was to preserve the genome coordinates relative to other Mycobacterium tuberculosis where the first base starts at the origin of replication.

The first and last contigs are contiguous. A single contig was split into two, in order to make dnaA the first gene in the chromosome.
Bacteria and source DNA available from Fedora Lanzas, Instituto Conmemorativo Gorgas de Estudios de la Salud, ICGES, Panama

bioprojects.title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis S96-129 Genome sequence project

assembly_info.submitter: Uppsala University, dep. of Medical Biochemistry and Microbiology
assembly_info.assembly_method: CLC Genomics Workbench v. 3.7, CLC Bio, Aarhus, Denmark
assembly_info.comments:
A single contig was split into two, AEGB01000001 and AEGB01000199. Consequently, the first and last contigs are contiguous. This split was to preserve the genome coordinates relative to the Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv reference sequence in NC_000962.
The annotation was added by the NCBI Prokaryotic Genome Annotation Pipeline (PGAP). Information about PGAP can be found here: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/annotation_prok/
